creator: apache@bakerweb.biz
text:
It is impossible to have iTunes software connect to the iTunes store through the
Apache 2.2.2 proxy. The initial page loads fine, but accessing links from the
iTunes front page generates errors in iTunes. The Apache error log reads:

[Tue Sep 19 14:04:03 2006] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] Digest: uri mismatch -
</WebObjects/MZStore.woa/wa/viewGenre> does not match request-uri
<http://ax.phobos.apple.com.edgesuite.net/WebObjects/MZStore.woa/wa/viewGenre?id=32>,
referer:
http://ax.phobos.apple.com.edgesuite.net/WebObjects/MZStore.woa/wa/storeFront

I already have that on or IE won't work through the proxy either. The actual
line from httpd.conf reads:

BrowserMatch "MSIE" AuthDigestEnableQueryStringHack=On
creator: apache@bakerweb.biz

text:
Sorry. Changing the UA to "iTunes" fixes it. I didn't know iTunes had its own UA
string.
creator: apache@bakerweb.biz
apache@bakerweb.biz
text:
Darn it!!! Subscribing to podcasts still doesn't work.

[Tue Sep 19 15:09:25 2006] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] Digest: uri mismatch - </>
does not match request-uri <phobos.apple.com:443>
[Tue Sep 19 15:10:17 2006] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] Digest: uri mismatch - </>
does not match request-uri <phobos.apple.com:443>
[Tue Sep 19 15:10:32 2006] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] Digest: uri mismatch - </>
does not match request-uri <phobos.apple.com:443>

Can you get a protocol trace at client<->proxy failing like this (e.g. using
ethereal/tcpdump)?  This looks like a client issue.
creator: jorton@redhat.com
apache@bakerweb.biz
text:
It appears that the communication is SSL and I don't have anything that's
capable of decoding an SSL conversation. I will try though when I'm back behind
the proxy.

It's the network trace of the traffic between iTunes and the proxy which is
important - that bit is not SSL.
creator: jorton@redhat.com
apache@bakerweb.biz
text:
Unfortunately the network setup is such that the connection to the proxy is
encrypted. There's nowhere for me to intercept it since Ethereal doesn't grab
loopback traffic.

creator: nick@webthing.com
text:
(In reply to comment #5)
> Darn it!!! Subscribing to podcasts still doesn't work.

Maybe there's another UA for podcasts?

What would I need to do with iTunes on my mac to make it use an apache proxy and
test this?

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text: No response to request for clarification.  Closing.
